item.title: It’s Now or Never For Insomniac’s Spider-Man Franchise To Feature One Villain
item.description:
Insomniac’s Marvel's: Spider-Man 2 left players with a lot of hanging plot threads for future titles to wrap up: the return of Otto, the surprise appearance of Cindy Moon (AKA the superhero Silk), the cliffhanger with Carnage, Peter’s soft retirement from superheroics, and of course, Norman Osborn’s looming transformation into the Green Goblin. With such a full plate for the third installment, there’s only one chance left for the studio to make good on one of its biggest villain teases from Marvel's Spider-Man 2 .

Amid the chaos of Marvel's Spider-Man 2 's symbiote invasion, eagle-eyed fans may have noticed the distinctive spiral symbol that appeared on the meteor that brought the invasion to Earth. While this might have slipped past some players, comic readers will have recognized this as the insignia of Knull, a recently created character and the driving force behind the 2020-2021 major crossover event The King in Black .

Insomniac Has One Chance Left to Feature Knull in its Spider-Man Games

Knull is the creator of the symbiote race. As such, his arrival on Earth would be a major deal; he is not a character that can be relegated to side quests like Tombstone or Chameleon. If Insomniac wants to tackle the King in Black, he needs to be one of the major story threats, if not the main antagonist outright. The problem is, the third and final game in Insomniac's trilogy is already looking a bit overstuffed with characters.

The story of all three games to date has been slowly building toward Norman Osborn’s descent into madness and eventual turn to supervillainy. It seems highly likely that the Green Goblin is the main villain of Marvel’s Spider-Man 3 ; his story has far too much momentum to fumble in the third act.

Marvel's Spider-Man 3's Plot is Already Too Crowded for Knull

There's also the surprise reveal of Silk/Cindy Moon and the return of Otto Octavius, the main villain from Marvel’s Spider-Man . His deeply personal relationships with Peter and Norman are going to factor heavily into the inevitable drama in Insomniac’s finale. On top of it all, Marvel’s Spider-Man 3 will need to touch on Peter’s retirement from the superhero biz and his inevitable return to web-slinging.

Juggling all these story beats and plot threads means it’s increasingly likely that Insomniac won’t be able to give the eldritch symbiote god the gravitas he demands in a third game in the mainline series. But there is one last place Knull could fit into Insomniac's Spider-Man mythos: the leaked Venom spinoff game.

Knull Could Work as the Main Villain in Insomniac’s Venom Game

Late last year, Insomniac was targeted by hackers who released the studio's upcoming slate of currently unannounced releases. Among them was a Venom standalone game tentatively titled Venom: Lethal Protector . Knull would be much more at home in a game about Venom, as the character was conceived for Venom's own comics. Knull would have to be the main villain, coming to Earth to set his agenda back on course after his previous symbiote invasion was foiled in Marvel’s Spider-Man 2 .

Fans who played the last game may balk at the idea and say that Carnage is the obvious contender for a Venom game after The Flame cult questline in Marvel's Spider-Man 2 . But Carnage was an acolyte of Knull during The King in Black in the comics and the years-long build up to it. With Cletus already a cult figure in the Flame missions, Carnage acting as a general in Knull’s invasion force would work wonders narratively, allowing for two of Venom’s greatest foes to feature in the character’s anticipated standalone game.

If Insomniac elects to forgo Knull in the Venom game, however, it’s probably best to let sleeping gods lie. The character commands too much narrative attention and too much build-up to waste any precious screen time in Marvel’s Spider-Man 3 on him when the game already has such a long to-do list. Fans have been waiting to see the end of some of these stories since the first game back in 2018. It would be downright criminal to neglect any of them in order to hype up a newly-introduced threat like Knull.

item.title: 5 Crossovers That Should Happen in Helldivers 2
item.description:
Highlights

  • Helldivers 2 is refocusing on monthly warbonds to keep content meaningful and engaging for players, starting with the Viper Commandos Warbond.
  • Potential crossovers with iconic sci-fi franchises like Killzone , Horizon: Zero Dawn , Mass Effect , Dead Space , and Doom could bring exciting new weapons and armor to the game.
  • Introducing characters like the Helghast, Automatons, Reapers, Isaac Clarke, and Doom Slayer could add fresh challenges and excitement to the ongoing galactic war in Helldivers 2 .

The core idea of a live-service game is to keep players engaged by throwing new content their way over time. Helldivers 2 , while enjoying a massive launch a few months back, is now seeing its player count dwindle because of a lack of new content. Those who have been playing since launch are now burned out because of grinding the same missions.

Hence, developer Arrowhead Game Studios has decided to spend more time on the monthly warbonds to make their content meaningful. This starts with the Viper Commandos Warbond, which clearly takes a lot of ideas from the 1987 Predator film with its macho-masculine jungle camo outfits. The new thematic approach is interesting because it opens up new doors for crossovers with other games. There are several critically acclaimed science-fiction hits out there, and it would be a wonder if Helldivers 2 manages to bring in its weapons, armor, etc.

5 The Helghast (Killzone)

Unflinching in the Face of Adversity

With the Killzone franchise shelved for the past decade, the best Sony Interactive Entertainment can do is consider green-lighting a crossover with Helldivers 2 . The Helghast, in particular, would fit right into the setting. Forcefully relocated for refusing to live under the ISA rule, the Killzone games taught a crucial lesson: not every person fighting for freedom is a terrorist. On that note, it would only be natural for some people on Super Earth to stop listening to the Ministry of Truth. It is all propaganda anyway.

The Helghast have some of the most iconic armor designs in history: ranging from the trench coat and gas mask in the early installments to the technologically advanced gear in the latter games. Some of their weapons, such as the M82 assault rifle and the StA-3 light machine gun, would also be a welcome addition to the armory.

The B-08 Light Gunner and CE-27 Ground Breaker armor sets in Helldivers 2 are the closest players can get to feeling like the Helghast.

4 The Machines (Horizon: Zero Dawn)

Transforming Beasts (& Bugs) Into Automaton Bots

The Automatons were originally created by the Cyborgs from the first Helldivers game as the next step in their evolution. They are entirely mechanical beings that no longer require human volunteers to manipulate their bodies with machines and technology. They are still based on humans, which begs the question of why the bot fabricators in Helldivers 2 cannot terraform other living beings such as the Terminids to create beast-like robots. If the Automatons were to do that, it would be a great opportunity for the Sony-owned Horizon franchise to do a major crossover in Helldivers 2 .

Some Terminid enemies are already featured as machines in the Horizon games, and that too, with the same names. The Stalker, for example, can turn completely invisible before attacking. There is also the Charger which can ram its targets at high speeds. There are several more machines from the Horizon bestiary that can cross over. The Ravager, for one, would be an excellent addition. Equipped for ranged and melee combat thanks to its mounted guns and sharp claws, imagine an Automaton robot beast charging you on all fours.

3 Commander Shepard (Mass Effect)

Ending the Cycle of Destruction, Again

It is hard to talk about potential science-fiction crossovers without mentioning the Mass Effect franchise. Featuring a range of iconic weapons and armor with unique passives, there is a lot of potential here to make fans happy in Helldivers 2 . With an all-new Mass Effect 4 in the works, it would perhaps be an opportunity to bring back Commander Shephard to take command in the ongoing galactic war for survival.

It would also be worth pointing out that the Reapers from the Mass Effect trilogy bear some similarities to the rumored Illuminate faction in Helldivers 2 . Both are highly advanced aliens stranded in another dimension, looking for a way back. The Ministry of Science could even utilize Illuminate technology to give players a form of biotic implants to create shield barriers and such.

2 Isaac Clarke (Dead Space)

Plasma Cutting Terminid Limbs Like Butter

What happened to the USG Ishimura will unlikely happen to players' Super Destroyers. The unique killing mechanics of Dead Space , though, do make for a comfortable crossover in Helldivers 2 . Targeting limbs is one of the many ways to beat most enemies like the Brood Commander and the Devastator . Including new enemies inspired by Dead Space that encourage players to target specific limbs, not just rain bullets, would certainly freshen up the Helldivers 2 bestiary.

In addition, the iconic Plasma Cutter from Dead Space needs to make an appearance in Helldivers 2 . The energy-based mining tool fires precision shots that slice through light enemies. Considering the existence of mining colonies in the Helldivers lore, it reasons that they are using something similar to extract minerals. Furthermore, any of the various RIGs worn by Isaac Clarke would be a welcome addition to the armory. That as well as the latter weapons such as the pulse and plasma rifles.

The Hand Cannon and its pew-pew animation would make for an excellent emote in Helldivers 2 .

1 Doom Slayer (Doom)

Putting the Hell in Helldivers

With the ongoing galactic war that has taken the lives of thousands of fellow divers, no one but the Doom Slayer would qualify as the perfect one-man army to defend Super Earth. The main protagonist of the Doom franchise has traveled through hellish dimensions and back multiple times to lay waste to their nightmarish armies. His disdain for demonic invasions would greatly help fend off both the Automaton and Terminid factions.

What also makes the Doom Slayer a perfect crossover for Helldivers 2 is the role of Mars. The planet was the central point of demonic invasions in the Doom games, and where the training facilities are located to train new divers in Helldivers 2 . Not to mention that his iconic shotgun and Praetor Suit would be a breath of fresh air in the armory. The SG-225 Breaker needs some competition, and something needs to be done about the lack of new armor designs.

item.title: Cyberpunk 2077: Why Project Orion Needs to Take the Corpo Lifepath Even Further
item.description:
Cyberpunk 2077 , despite its infamously messy launch, has shaped up to become a rather impressive and enjoyable action-RPG. The game certainly leans more into the "action" side of its identity, with its RPG elements, at least narratively, being somewhat restrictive. This balance between role-playing and open-world adventure game works well for Cyberpunk 2077 , but its sequel, Project Orion , should aim to improve across both vectors.

When it comes to Cyberpunk 2077 's RPG shortcomings, few features are more discussed than character backgrounds, called "lifepaths" in-game. Players can choose from three different backgrounds, Corpo, Street Kid, and Nomad, and this decision will determine the prologue of the game, along with some occasional bits of background-exclusive dialog and short side quests. Many players feel that this feature, which was heavily touted by CD Projekt Red during Cyberpunk 's marketing, doesn't live up to its full potential, as V's story ultimately plays out the same way regardless of which lifepath is chosen. Likewise, lifepath decision offers little in the way of unique gameplay content or strong replay value.

Project Orion Can Improve All Lifepaths, But Corpo Needs the Most Attention

The Corpo Lifepath May Be Cyberpunk's Most Interesting

While lifepaths don't impact Cyberpunk 2077 's ending or the main story in any meaningful way, they are great for developing headcanons, as they foster unique perspectives on the game's narrative. For instance, the Nomad lifepath adds additional context to narrative beats concerning the Aldecaldos and Panam's romance subplot, even when it's not being explicitly referenced. Another example: V's transformation into a Night City Legend may feel more gratifying under the Street Kid lifepath, as the transformation from scrappy, street-wise youth is a bit more natural.

But the Corpo lifepath offers the most dramatic narrative contrasts. It can be satisfying to watch V's transformation from Corpo lackey to rung-climbing gangster, but this dichotomy can also feel a bit forced. V's immediate rejection of their white-collar, cutthroat corporate background in favor of a life as a low-level criminal makes for interesting storytelling, but the fact that this transformation is forced in the early moments of the game, rather than being just one possible plot direction, negatively impacts player agency. This is something Project Orion can address.

It's considerably easier to believe that Street Kid V or Nomad V would strive to be a tough-as-nails Night City merc, so the fact that players are railroaded across this narrative arc is less of an issue under these lifepaths.

The Corpo Lifepath Could Offer an 'Evil Playthrough' Option in Project Orion

Cyberpunk 2077 presents future corporations as ruthless, amoral, and fundamentally corrupt. There are no 'good Corpos' and 'bad Corpos'—every corporation is ethically compromised, and those who serve them are complicit in their evil deeds, no matter how decent they may be in their daily life. All this is to say that, in the Cyberpunk world, evil is systemic and spread across millions of smaller cogs, rather than being defined by the actions of individuals.

If CD Projekt Red wants to flesh out character backgrounds, then Project Orion 's version of the Corpo lifepath ought to allow players to engage with this pervasive system of evil throughout the course of their playthrough.

Perhaps a character who kicks off their game as a Corpo can continue serving corporate interests in exchange for certain rewards, monetary or otherwise. Alternatively, the decision to reject corporate life would feel more weighty, as players would be actively eschewing a real, tangible narrative option.

Cyberpunk 2077 's main story is great, but players don't actually have much of a hand in shaping it, at least not before its final hours. By offering a narrative and thematic alternative that is fundamentally opposed to the game's core message, Project Orion could be a better role-playing experience while delivering on the early promises of the lifepath system.

item.title: Pokemon GO: How To Get Shiny Komala
item.description:
Pokemon GO players can encounter a Shiny Komala in numerous ways. You can encounter a Komala and Shiny Komala in the wild or as a Research task encounter during events featuring it. But encountering a Shiny monster isn’t as easy as getting a Regular variant.

The Pokemon GO Slumbering Sands event on Friday, June 7, 2024, at 10 AM Local Time debuts Shiny Komala . The Normal-type monster has a maximum Combat Power (CP) of 2919 and an offense-centric stat spread of 216 ATK, 165 DEF, and 163 STA. There are different methods of encountering a Shiny Komala: hunt it in the wild, get it as a Research task encounter, or get it as a Collection Challenge reward. That said, this guide details the best way to get Shiny Komala in the game.

How To Get A Shiny Komala In Pokemon GO

Pokemon GO events like Slumbering Sands feature Komala as a wild spawn, Research task encounter, and Collection Challenge reward. These events increase Komala's spawn rate, which can help in encountering a Shiny Komala. While there is no surefire way to encounter a Shiny variant, you can try to match its Shiny odds using different methods.

Pokemon GO: Get Shiny Komala As A Wild Spawn

Shiny Komala is a wild spawn, and you can increase your chances of encountering it by strategically using various Pokemon GO items. Several in-game items can increase the wild Pokemon spawn rate. The more Komala you encounter, the faster you might match its Shiny odds.

Pokemon GO Incense, Lure Modules, and Weather Boosts function can boost wild Pokemon spawn rate. Komala experiences a Weather Boost in areas with partly cloudy weather. You must locate a PokeStop or Gym in partly cloudy weather , attach a Lure Module , activate an Incense , and traverse around that spot . Doing so during events that already boost Komala’s spawn rate can increase it even more.

Pokemon GO: Get Shiny Komala As A Research Task Encounter

Events that feature Komala reward you with a Shiny Komala encounter through Research quests. The Pokemon GO Slumbering Sands offers different Research tasks, and completing a particular one can reward a Shiny Komala encounter; the specific event provides a higher chance of Shiny Komala spawning through a Research task when compared to a wild spawn. While the Shiny encounter isn’t guaranteed, completing multiple tasks can help you catch up to its Shiny odds.
